verses.verse: So since the Anointed King suffered on our behalf in a physical body, you also must arm yourselves with the same internal way of thinking because the person who suffered in a physical body has stopped sin
for the "for the remaining time in a physical body to no longer be lived for desires of people but for what God wants" part.

You see, the time of the life that has passed by is enough for us to work on and complete what the non-Jews want, having traveled in indulgent activities, desires, times with too much wine, wild parties, drinking binges and prohibited idol worship;
in which they think it is strange that you don't run together with them in the same obsession of the recklessness as they say hurtful things,
who will give back an answer to the One who has Himself ready to judge living people and dead people.
You see, for this, good news was also shared with dead people, so that they might certainly be judged in line with people in the physical body, but they may live in line with God in the spirit.
The conclusion of everything has come near. So you all must be properly focused and sober for the prayers,
but having intensive love among yourselves before everyone (because the love covers up a large number of sins),
friendly to strangers among each other, devoid of grumblings.
Just as each person received a gift, people should be serving the same thing among themselves as nice managers of the varied generosity of God.

If someone speaks, he should speak as God's utterances. If someone serves, he should serve as from strength that God supplies so that in all things God may be made magnificent through Jesus, the Anointed King, with whom is the magnificence and the power for the spans of time of the spans of time. Amen.
Loved ones, don't think the burning among you is strange, that is becoming close to trouble for you, as a strange thing transpiring with you.
But as to what you share in the hardships of the Anointed King, be happy so that also during the uncovering of His magnificence you would be happy, being excited.

If you are insulted for the Anointed King's name, you are blessed because the spirit of the magnificence and the Spirit of God relaxes on you. Throughout them, hurtful things are certainly said about Him, but throughout you all, He is made magnificent.
You see, none of you must suffer as a murderer, or a thief, or a person who does bad things, or as a meddler.
But if someone suffers as a Christian, he must not be ashamed. He must make God magnificent in this part

because it is the time of the "for the judgment to begin out from the house of God" part. If it is first out from us, what will the conclusion be of the people who do not believe the good news of God?
And if the person who does what is right is rescued with a lot of effort, the godless and sinful person, where will he appear?
In such a way, the people who suffer in line with what God wants must also place their own souls as if beside a trustable Creator in doing good.
